title: Timothy Tillman enjoys success with LAFC , eyes USMNT roster spot

As football evolved from a backyard hobby to an unforgiving profession, where talented players he had grown up with were being released to make way for new players from around the world, the pathway to the first team at Bayern became hazy. At that point, he was a tricky winger who modelled his game after former Manchester United, Portugal and Orlando City forward Nani. He featured six times as the team was relegated to Bundesliga 2. I saw it as a perfect option to get back on track because, after the injury, I was ready to start in the second division or maybe with another team in the Bundesliga. I felt good, like I was back on track again.â€

When LAFC came calling in January, it fulfilled an aspiration Tillman has had from childhood, growing up as a dual-national.

After retiring as a player, Cherundolo honed his coaching skills with the Hannover and German national teamâ€™s youth sides, where he helped develop Linton Maina, Tillmanâ€™s best friend in the youth national team set-up.

In Los Angeles, Tillman is arguably playing the best football of his career. The versatile No. 8 fits perfectly into Cherundoloâ€™s midfield, combining athleticism of a 6-foot-1 stature with the technical quality of a player groomed as an attacker with Bayern and Germany. Through 13 games across MLS and the CONCACAF Champions League, he has registered three goals and two assists, his highest goal contribution rate since turning professional.

Naturally, as a dual-national performing well in MLS, and with a brother already committed to the team, anticipation has risen within the U.S. soccer scene regarding Tillmanâ€™s international allegiance.
Malik Tillman, who has featured for USMNTâ€™s senior squad on four occasions, was more familiar to soccer fans in the United States before Timothy joined LAFC in February. Having first appeared for the USMNTâ€™s U-15 squad in 2015, Malik, like Timothy, moved through the age ranks of Germanyâ€™s national team from U-15 to U-21 but applied for a one-time switch to represent the U.S. in May 2022.

After a glowing endorsement from his brother, Timothy has now applied for the one-time switch, and, should it be approved by FIFA, he will be eligible for this summerâ€™s Nations League and Gold Cup matches.
â€œWhen (Malik) joined the senior national team, he told me how much he enjoyed being with the team. He only had positive words about it,â€ said Tillman. â€œI would be happy if I got called up, but itâ€™s all in the coachâ€™s hands. Weâ€™ll see. Iâ€™d be proud to represent the U.S. in any game.â€
Without a permanent head coach, it is unclear whether the USMNT will operate with the 4-3-3 adopted by Gregg Berhalter. The first-choice midfield triumvirate there, Tyler Adams, Yunus Musah and Weston McKennie, all of whom play in top-5 European leagues, will be difficult to unseat.
Encouragingly, though Tillman has displayed the ability to play several different roles inside the No. 8 position, with his complete midfield display in the Champions League semifinal second leg against Philadelphia Union, registering a goal, 24 out of 30 accurate passes (80% completion rate), two dribbles and a tackle won, demonstrating he is someone who can be relied upon in and out of possession in big matches.
Still, Tillmanâ€™s feet remain firmly on the ground. At 24 years old, his best years are ahead of him in a club situation that he enjoys personally and professionally. If the quality performances continue, a move back to Europe could tempt him, but he is in no rush to make the trip across the Atlantic.
